This is my first post, and I am happy to start my blogging journey from here.
During my bachelor’s study in Statistics, I begin to analyze data with renowned Iris dataset, which has plenty of features to be classified, summarized and visualized. As a polysemy, “iris” represents both iris flowers(“È∏¢Â∞æ”) and the colored part of the eye(“ËôπËÜú”): Van Gogh gazed at the flowers.
I think life is just like the end of April: Although one missed the peach blooms, it is still beautiful now. The roses, poppies, and azaleas are all in bloom. So I want to seize the present day and say to all the people who passed by my life: Welcome to my garden.
In my childhood, blogging was a popular method for recording life. Bulaoge(‰∏çËÄÅÊ≠å), whose Chinese pronunciation resembles “blog” in English, was an outstanding blogging platform in China at that time. However, as time passed, traditional blogging was gradually replaced by shorter forms of expression such as microblogs (like Weibo and Twitter) and vlogs. With no surprise, Bulaoge disappeared along with the shift in trends.
Now, I wish to adopt the Chinese meaning “timeless song” from Bulaoge to name my blog. This not only serves as a tribute to the golden years of the past but also serves as a reminder to cherish each moment and document my life’s journey.

Abstract The method of grass snake and gray line(“ËçâËõáÁÅ∞Á∫øÊ≥ï”) is a narrative technique originating from Chinese classical novels, which connects events, appearing successive characters, forming readers‚Äôexpectation horizons, and suggesting the trend of plots. It has been used by a lot of literary creators to write unexpected but reasonable articles. Journey under the midnight sun, considered as the peak work of the famous Japanese detective novelist Keigo Higashino, is a modern variant of the the method of grass snake and gray line. Its enduring artistic charm shows that this technique is not out of date. Through text mining and social network analysis, this paper restores the novel’s time axis, explores the characters’ appearance frequency and sequence, and draws social network maps, which makes the role factions clear at a glance and verifies the strong connection between the two main characters. The study shows that text mining and social network analysis still have more values to be exploited in exploring complex literary works. This paper fills in the current research gap in this field, predicting that after introducing more modern statistical techniques, literary research will break through the restrictions of qualitative analysis and open up a new paradigm for studying literary works.

content:
As an enrolled postgraduate in Language Technology, I am really interested in so-called language. (Statistics can also be seen as a subject mainly composed of mathematical language and computer language.) Since I was young, I have had a unique talent that words can make me have “synaesthesia”: Each word conjures specific meanings and paints vivid images in my mind. To me, the world is a vast tapestry woven from words, grammar, sounds, and their endless combinations, each giving rise to different genres and expressions.
In the process of growing up, I began to contact English as my first foreign language. Later, I learned French, Russian, and Finnish out of interest. Now Swedish has been my most recent addition. Through this linguistic odyssey, I’ve come to appreciate the nuances and connections between different language systems.
With the development of the times, language is given endless vitality. Especially during the pandemic, the Internet has accelerated the formation of an extreme online language system. It is easy to slip into the “dualism” in the constantly reversed lies and truth without an eye on emerging concepts, making the relationships between people more torn.
My previous experiences also supported my interests in language. My undergraduate thesis took the novel Journey under the Midnight Sun by Japanese writer Keigo Higashino as the research object. Through text mining and social network analysis, the network diagram is drawn to make the role faction clear at a glance and verify the strong connection between the two protagonists. After graduation, I gained a lot of data analysis experience in multiple fields, including automobile, online finance, and content marketing, where online text is a critical analysis object, like comments and “bullet screens”. It was during this time that I became intrigued by the concept of “Online Discourse”, recognizing its pivotal role in shaping strategic decisions. Meanwhile, I realized my need for deeper professional knowledge in the latest language technology to connect to the exciting Large Language Model era.
In a sense, language shapes everything in human society, and I want to know more about it ‚Äî‚Äî that is why I am here.
